title: How Many Calories in a Cup of Mashed Potatoes?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cup of mashed potatoes, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy recipe tweaks for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cup of Mashed Potatoes?
assumptions: Prepared from russet potatoes with 2 tbsp butter and 1/4 cup milk per cup, salted, no skin; about 210 g serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato type, added fats, milk type, and cooking method. Check recipes or labels for precision.

quick_answer.text: A cup of mashed potatoes typically contains about 237 calories and 36 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp sour cream per cup
Use low-fat milk and half the butter

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of mashed potatoes with butter?
faqs.a: About 237 kcal for a standard recipe with butter and milk.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in mashed potatoes per cup?
faqs.a: Roughly 36 g of carbohydrates, including 3 g fiber.

faqs.q: Are mashed potatoes high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 652 mg per cup due to added salt and butter; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: How does preparation affect calories in mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: Adding more butter or cream increases calories; plain boiled potatoes are lower at ~87 kcal per cup.

faqs.q: Protein in a cup of mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: About 4 g, making it a carb-heavy side rather than a protein source.
